#' @rdname coordinates geographical_to_acoscartesian <- function(x) structr:::cartesian_to_acoscartesian( geographical_to_cartesian2(x) )

smallcircle.Rd

Creates a small circle (or spherical cone) by specifying the axis and the half apical angle

Usage

smallcircle(lat, lon, angle = 90, n = 1000L)

Arguments

lat

numeric. Latitude of the Euler pole (in degrees)

lon

numeric. Longitude of the Euler pole (in degrees)

angle

numeric. Angle of small circle (half apical angle of the spherical cone). If angle = 90, the great circle is returned.

n

integer. resolution of the return. Amount of points along small circle (1000 by default).

Value

sf object

Details

#' @rdname coordinates acoscartesian_to_geographical <- function(x) cartesian_to_geographical2( structr:::acoscartesian_to_cartesian(x) )

Small circle around a given pole

Examples

smallcircle(45, 10, 12.3)
